channel.title: Server online but wont work
channel.description: ok my server goes online but i cant connect to it noone can why is that[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 02, 2008, 11:32:56 am[/size][hr]can someone help plz

item.title: Server online but wont work
item.dc:creator: @udieformenow udieformenow
item.description:
@udieformenow wrote:

ok im not stupid my portforward i setup people have been on my server before but now for some random reason they cant connect and i changed nothing

item.title: Server online but wont work
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

You need to port forward. Doing it right as well, because if you do it wrong… It will not work, end of. There has been many questions just like this, replied with many tutorials and help for this same situation. Please use the search button.

Read full topic

item.title: Server online but wont work
item.dc:creator: @kedonot1 kedonot1
item.description:
@kedonot1 wrote:

[quote=“Bryanc, post:7, topic:229410”][quote author=Free link=topic=301797.msg2421842#msg2421842 date=1220387118]
Yea you have to use 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0, you can’t connect to your server with a no-ip address. When you want to play type 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 to login
[/quote]
youfail.org
i can connect to my own no-ip
False… You CAN connect to your own server with no-ip

Also, is there any errors in the command prompt when you run the server? Or when someone trys to login… including you.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Server online but wont work
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Yeah, the no-ip can be used locally but is really dumb. Since it has to go find the host (your computer on the internet) So it does have more lag compared to using localhost.

So yes, you CAN use the no-ip or the localhost, while others use the no-ip. But localhost is preferred.

Read full topic
